Piss off
People: Helen, Grannie, Eleanor & Antonia, Fran, Hattie, Jamie, Hannah, Robert
Locations: Glasgow, Edinburgh, Lincoln, Swanley,Bath, Stonehenge, London, Lisbon

Description: Met Helen at the station. To the abbey. The floors were caving in because of the decomposing dead bodies below. Listened to a women's choir. The organ looked like the Mouth of Sauron. Had some Jaffa Cake ice cream in the square. Watched a bit of a Boules tournament. Good cold brew. Saw many hen parties.
Locations: Glasgow, Edinburgh, Lincoln, Swanley,Bath, Stonehenge, London, Lisbon

Description: Train to Swanley and met Elaine. Hung at the house for a little while and then went to dinner at The Castle. Fondue with bread and crispy sweet glazed ham bits. Liz got a grand bowl of mussels and now I know what pork hoc is. David and Elaine told us tales of Norwegian ships and South African trains. We drank a cape town liqueur and Chivas Regal.
Locations: Glasgow, Edinburgh, Lincoln, Swanley,Bath, Stonehenge, London, Lisbon

Description:
I fell asleep in the car while Liz and Jane went into a store. I dreamt of being attacked by spiders. I woke up to find two cute spiders hanging out in the car with me. I had no bites. Jane's humans were nice, the dogs were big, the cat was small, the pigs wanted shoes, the hogs were dirty, the chickens were plentiful, the seagulls & duck were adorable, the hedgehogs were wheezy, the town was quaint, the church was tall. We ate mustard seed chicken, strawberries, and sticky toffee pudding.

The next morning I took pictures of animals and Jane made us an incredible full English Breakfast.
Locations: Glasgow, Edinburgh, Lincoln, Swanley,Bath, Stonehenge, London, Lisbon

Description:
Took a train to meet Chris, Amy, and Ruby. To Urban Angel for fennel soup and sandwich. Drank an Ardbeg flight before climbing the big staircase up to the Royal Mile. Up the Mile and looked at whisky. Drank Cocktails at Bramble and had a great meal at Burger Meats Bun. Watched some World Cup at the house: 7-1 Germany over Brazil. Ruby brought a blanket.

Biscuits dipped in chocolate for breakfast. Bus ride and a hike up to Arthur's Chair. Liz napped, I put on sunscreen. Bought clotted cream fudge and Iron Bru from a gift shop. Amy made an excellent Burmese fish curry and we watched another football match.
Locations: Glasgow, Edinburgh, Lincoln, Swanley,Bath, Stonehenge, London, Lisbon

Description:
The first local I encountered upon disembarking from the plane was the customs officer, who was incomprehensible. Many women wore parachute pants. Took a bus to St. George Square. There was a Sir Walter Scott statue. We explored the Necropolis. There was trash in mausoleums and there were many crumbling statues. Had some tablet ice cream. To a Tiki bar called Tiki Bar & Kitsch Inn for some drinks and foosball.

Haggis and other treats for breakfast. Floating heads, Christ suspended, coffee, organ music, and a barnacle dick at the Kelvingrove Museum. Holy mother of India. To the Transport Museum for trains, a big, green couch, and my first 99. Saw a talented BMX rider hopping around. Met Hope and John at the bell tower. Headed to Meat Bar for meaty drinks. To the house for hot chocolate, spiced gin, and some good vinyl listening.
Locations: Glasgow, Edinburgh, Lincoln, Swanley,Bath, Stonehenge, London, Lisbon

Description: On the bus ride from Reno the driver asked if we would like to take a break. A woman shouted 'I ain't showered in two days'. A woman with probably schitzophrenia sat behind me cursing, crying, and sometimes hitting my seat. Had dinner with Dad and Barb and played some guitar. Off the next morning.

Met mom and Jim. Checked out the classic car show for a while. Listened to the Righteous Brothers for a while. Attended a wedding party, for which Jim had served as the officiant. Ate sushi. Watched people scale a building. Played more roulette and probably lost.

Took a cable car over a favela and to Arvi Park. Had lulo juice and grilled mushrooms. Did a nice mountain walk. Saw cats and dogs. Ate fruits and yogurt. Wandered the favela below the cable car. It was lovely and festive, but I felt out of place. To the touristy area of El Poblado. I had a carne fajita cone. It felt very inauthentic. I tried to find local music. I found a group, but they were busking directly to couples on the street and not just playing for pleasure. A man wearing nearly twenty stacked hats followed them and tried to sell hats. I found a rock cover band doing the Cranberries at a bar. I stayed and had Calamari — or possibly pig rectum.

Hostel breakfast. To Plaza Botero. Saw the wildest street entertainer I have ever seen. I couldn't understand any of it. He may have been out of his mind, but his stuff really felt like a serious commentary on society. He put a lit cigarette into a toy gorilla's mouth. He mad some interesting tubes out of rolled paper. Then cut some newspaper with a razor blade and demonstrated how it would not slice open his jugular or palm. He then unbuttoned his shirt to reveal a safety pin piercing his nipple. Attached to the pin was a small cloth bag containing conical diamond shaped black pebbles. These pebbles apparently had the effect of removing coloring from water. I left. In the museum, I very much enjoyed the Botero works. Went to Pergamino, had a great coffee, and watched the game with a room of about 60 people. Colombia won. Afterward the streets were a joyous party for the rest of the evening. Many people (myself included) were spraying foam all over. It was reminiscent of Holi. Much chanting was chanted.

A young kid driving a truck took me to the airport. MDE>MIA>ATL>CHI>DFW!

Got in late. Cab to hostel.

It was a bit rainy. Did a bike tour with about ten other tourists. Five minutes in I slipped and fully tore my already ripped pants. Rode through lots of scary traffic. Saw a fruit market, good graffiti, a former children's cemetery turned public park, the university, pickpockets, a coffee roastery, a bullfighting arena, big matador bulges, and people setting up for the World Cup. Bought new pants. Walked to Plaza Bolivar to watch Colombia play in the cup. The plaza was packed, there was a live projection of the game onto the side of a building and it was all very energetic. I drank sweet tea, ate a hot dog, and saw a llama.

A wet walk and a masa y queso cake to Monserrate. The cable car was great, the top was cold. Had a Negroni at Tabula. Got starstruck when Tomas came out to give me dining advice. Nice bread with olive oil and tomato paste, ceviche with plantain chips, grilled pork belly, artichoke and mozzarella soup, meatballs. Toured Museo del Oro. Wandered markets in La Candelaria and left the westerner area. It was neat and uncomfortable. Met Garrison at the bus depot, had a meal and watched some game. A very long bus ride with some shitty food, but good convo.

Came to NY to celebrate our one-year wedding anniversary. Saw Todd & Sophie play in Brooklyn. Went to Momofuku for ramen and another noodle dish. Walked to Pouring Ribbons for incredible cocktails including our first clarified milk punch, which is now one of our favorite cocktails. Rooftop hand with Todd and Sophie.

To Smorgisburg for ahi tartar nachos, a brisket sandwich, and a nice view of the city. To Catbird to swap a ring for Liz. Then to Blue Bottle for coffee, and to Goorin Bros for straw hats. Took the train to Coney Island in time for the Mermaid Parade. Saw many drag queens, boobs, and sequins. Picked up a good selection of roots and spices for making bitters at Kalustyan's. Had dinner at the tall and loud Beauty & Essex. Drank strong drinks and bought a fancy stirring glass at Amor y Amargo. Drank more drinks with Todd and Sophie at Death & Co. More rooftop hanging with good humans and a weiner dog.

Rode trains and ate chewy everything bagels.

Lizards, snails rival soccer teams
Sleepy market kitten, old man shucking beans
Wallace & Gabe got his keyboard again
Orpheus, Eurydice, This is the End
Sauron, swords, caldinhos, fried cheese on a stick
Açúcar, suco, tapioca, caipirinhas, fish dicks
Fred the dog, dueling PAs, old parade on the street
I keep using a phrase I don't know what it means
Choro, cachaca, Amy's stew was for real
Prison mall, gigantes, girl kiss girl no big deal
Spider monkeys, coffee, the park, crepes, caju
For the wonderful time please accept our 'Thank you'!

Mom & Jim had condo ready for us with B-day gifts and beer inside. They made a towel dog on the bed. Met Honey, Jim's parrot.

Mom made eggs and moldy cheese. To Palm Springs and a Mexican restaurant. Many people were dancing to the live band. To Bar, which was disappointing. Saw vintage cars and houses. Saw two Elvis houses and toured one of them. Had a great birthday dinner and many Mai Tais at Roy's Hawaiian Fusion. A woman photo bombed our b-day pic, then felt bad and bought me a drink. I photobombed someone elses and did not feel bad. To another bar and met Jim's son Justin.

Mother's Day brunch at the Elks Lodge. Bloody Marys and met Jake. Back to PHX.

Ate a terrible hotel breakfast at our cheap hotel. Went to Rio for Viva Las Vegas. In the vintage clothing area I bought a sweet, olive-green 60's suit. Liz found a sweater and necklace. Watched a man give a slideshow featuring lovely mid-century buildings that were mostly now demolished. Had drinks and burrito. Listened to some live music. Attended the Steady party with Stevie and Tara. Saw some okay comedy. Ate at Burgr. Then drinks at Frankie's Tiki Room.

Breakfast at DuPar's for pancakes and an omelet. Took pictures at the huge car show. We just missed the swimsuit competition, but Liz and I both got a crush on an adorable woman walking around in a thong bikini and chiffon kimono. Ate some Mexican food. Attended the burlesque competition and had front row tickets. There was a lot of spirit. We met our favorite girls after. They were lovely, though quite sad because they placed so poorly. Did Burlesque Bingo. Liz won the first round and danced on stage.

To Anthony's. Nap in the car before going in. A man drove a car into a crowd that night. With Anthony and Cheyenne to Beerland. Elvis Busts and a good all female band.

Up late. Pitchfork Fest. Okay bands. Good pork sandwiches. Whole Foods for nice juice with salt. Xenakis album from Waterloo. 'Pi in the Sky' written by airplanes. Gian and friend picked us up. Saw some pretty good bands at a church. Kimchi fried rice w/pork belly and egg. Jolene, Ryan, and Amy.

Met Ryan and Amy again for Jim's Breakfast. I probably had the chicken fried steak. Big antique shopping mall. Met Anthony to see Destruction Unit blow the power twice and give up. Incredible cacio e pepe from a food truck. There was an awesome luchador mask wearing surf rock band. To a pool hall for great bands, including our favorite, JP5 (the Joey Plunkett 5, no relation).

Good coffee from Houndstooth. Incredible beef rib and brisket from La Barbecue. Saw JP5 again at the Warehouse. Red 7 for Speedy Ortiz. I won a Windows tablet. East Side Kings for miso ramen, brussels sprout salad beet fries. Endless Bummer & Destruction Unit at Spider House. Liz guessed her b-day present (Rocky Horror Picture Show Soundtrack on vinyl) and was nearly in tears from a difficult round of 20 questions. Pumpkin home brew, meat leftovers, NBA Jam.

Houndstooth coffee.

Picked up Liz from the airport. I gave her flowers, chocolates, a book, and a poem. She gave me a handmade Valentine's Day card, a cocktail book, and a Stones shirt. Toured the Titan Missile Museum. We learned that a bobcat used to sleep on the silo cover. Next to the Big Room at Kartchner Caverns. The lighting was incredible and it was a very emotional experience. To our Royal Mansion at the Shady Dell, a vintage Airstream trailer park. Cafe Roka for dinner and back to the Dell.

I brought back Bisbee Breakfast Club for breakfast in bed with Liz. Downtown shopping for vinyl (Sly - Fresh, Dire Straits - Brothers in Arms) and a washboard. To the San Xavier Mission. No fry bread, but nice decor. Jax cafe for nice food. Pistachio coated goat cheese balls and duck confit tacos. Home to Puppy.

On the light rail, and older woman recommend I don't smoke pot in Texas. To the National mall where we explored the Air and Space Museum. In one exhibit they had Eric Idle's Galaxy Song playing on a loop. Had a cocktail and snack with Mom in a fancy bar. Saw the back of the White House.

Visited the Lincoln Memorial then ran to the airport.

Blue Plate Diner for grilled cheese and tomato soup, roast beef sandwich with basic cream, and an egg cream soda. Bought books at Powell's. Got coffee and did a photobooth at Stumptown. Had a beer flight, chicken tenders, and oyster shooters at the Rogue Brewery. To Alberta for strawberry balsamic ice cream and a perch bleu cheese ice cream. Train to plane home.

Up the 87 to snowy Payson. Bought whipped honey from roadside stand. A man explained the camel statues at La Posada and how people used camels in the Sonoran Desert in the 19th century. Lunch in the Turquoise Room: burger and a nice pork dish. Checked out the nice art in the hotel. To Wigwam Village in Holbrook. It was adorable and we bought a wigwam Christmas ornament. The room was small and quaint. We talked a lot, shared stories, snacked, drank Bailey's, and read.

Drove to the Petrified Forest. Had a nap in the car. Saw 'Geronimo', the largest piece of petrified wood in the region. Back to Turquoise Room for another burger and soup. Then back home.

Waffle w/custard, strawberries, and bananas. Spent a few hours feeling deep joy in the Van Gogh Museum. McDonald's lunch. Tulip bulbs for Catherine, Phoebe, and us from the floating flower market on the canal. Had a green thing. Cheesy fondue at The Cheese Factory. They had a restaurant cat named Simba. Walked through the red light district. Crepe with cherries and whipped cream. Guys trying to rap in our 12-bed hostel at 2am made it difficult to fall asleep.

Meh kebab for breakfast. Had raclette on the street. Wandered and explored the beautiful city. Had a nice coffee drink called a Bambino. Hung out for a few hours at the public library. I drew a picture of the library. Fries w/curry ketchup, Krakauer.

Grocery store for chocolate and pesto. Plane home.
Locations: Berlin, Quedlinburg, Hann Munden, Bonn, Cologne, Essen, Dusseldorf, Amsterdam

Description: To Bonn, birthplace of Beethoven. Had cappuccinos and something like a Pari- Brest. Picked up ornaments for our mothers from a Christmas Market. Ate cooked mushrooms and a pretzel. Drank gluhwein with rum. Essen for currywurst, a ladle for Krystle, and table runner for D&B. Dusseldorf for Krakauer and fries. Liqueur for Fred and candle spinner for J&D. Train to Amsterdam. Stinky hostel room #2.
Locations: Berlin, Quedlinburg, Hann Munden, Bonn, Cologne, Essen, Dusseldorf, Amsterdam

Description: Rented up a Mercedes and Liz drove. She liked that car very much. Drove down the Autobahn. It was very nice. Had coffee and a Berliner from a gas station. To Quedlinburg first. It was a quaint Medieval town with a large castle. Lunch at Soljanka consisted of a schnitzel, a brat, potatoes and cabbage. Driving through the countryside was all quite majestic. Next to Hann Munden. We arrived at night. It was notable for its large stone tower which was illuminated in purple. Ate some mediocre pizza then drove to Cologne. Stayed in our first stinky hostel.
Locations: Berlin, Quedlinburg, Hann Munden, Bonn, Cologne, Essen, Dusseldorf, Amsterdam

Description:
30 min into flight from Newark we turned around because the pilot said it smelled like dirty socks. Apparently that can be a sign of something important leaking out of where it is meant to be. Next day on an Air Berlin flight to Berlin. Early morning. Two drunk young men were walking around the train station with golf clubs looking for a place to play. Reichstag was full so we made a booking for the next day. Cafe and sandwiches. Brandenburg Gate. Did the Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe. Out front were ominous large stone blocks you were meant to walk in between. Tried the flea market, but it was closing. We still caught Elton John the Robot, a currywurst, and a waffle. Relaxed in the hostel a bit. Out late for a great kebab.

Reichstag wander. Saw some Wall, but not much. Christmas Market between two churches. Fries with quark and green onions were incredible, as was the Krakauer and cocoa. Bought artisanal cream cheese from a witty vendor and some incredible stone baked bread for later. Pergamon Museum: Ishtar Gate of Babylon, a Roman marketplace entrance, and the Pergamon Altar. They were massive and incredible to see inside a museum. Bread and cheese for dinner.
Locations: Berlin, Quedlinburg, Hann Munden, Bonn, Cologne, Essen, Dusseldorf, Amsterdam

Description:
Crashed with Mom at the Grand Sierra during her Postal Convention. Drank Rumchata with her in her room. Drank some Ichthyosaur IPA. Had all you can eat sushi in the hotel restaurant. It was surprisingly delicious. Played roulette and watched a man put down $500 in one spin and lose it all. He walked away as though that wasn't a big deal.

Day trip to Mt. Rose, Lake Tahoe, and the Bloody Bucket. Flew back.

To Burgr for a mushroom burger with goat cheese and fries with curry ketchup. Played roulette. Saw Jubilee, the oldest show in Vegas. It was a bit dated, quite cheesy, and we loved it. To Frankie’s Tiki Room. It smelled like smoke, it was dim and kind of dingy, there were old nautical items hanging from the ceiling covered in dust, the drinks were cheap, the drinks were strong, the drinks were delicious...we loved it. We bought two souvenir mugs. We saw Ryan at the airport.

Met Phil and hung around his place for a while. Liz and I went to a comedy show. Walking there and man came up from behind and push me hard. I fell to the ground. He immediately started yelling at me and threatening to beat me up. We were very confused. After a minute he stormed off. We were dumbfounded. A minute later he returned, continued yelling at me and threatening me, and then stormed off for good. I still don't know why that happened. It was difficult to enjoy the comedy show. The fact that the comedy was terrible didn't help.

To Philz coffee for breakfast. Then to Rooky Ricardo’s where I picked up some good 60's female soul mixes. Drank peanut milk shakes. To Haight Street where we met a girl named Kali and she was kind enough to share some snacks with us. Dazed wandering in Whole Foods. Walked around Golden Gate Park where we found some incredible roller skaters. One roller skater sat down on a bench for a break and a snack. Soon, a squirrel came up to him and jumped onto his knee. He was not surprised. He handed the squirrel a treat. The animal took a treat and ate it next to him. To El Zocalo for cheesy, greasy, delicious Pupusas. Then to El Rio for well drinks and burlesque. I accidentally left my phone on the BART on the way to meet Phil at Press Club, where we drank wine and smelled many dried spices in a box (meant to help train one's wine nose). Back at the station I talked to the station officer and we used Find My iPhone. We saw that my phone was now in Oakland, but it moving quickly towards us. We realized that it was still on the train and was coming back our way. When the train arrived at our station they held it briefly while Liz called and we scoured the seats. We, unfortunately, didn't find it and the train pulled away. Then someone answered the phone. It was a woman who picked up my phone at that station when Liz had been calling it. She met us on the street above and returned my phone. We gave her Oreos and cab fare home since she missed her bus. Phil thought she was cute.

To Philz Coffee again for delicious drinks. To Ocean Beach to see the sand castle competition, but it was canceled due to the government shutdown. Headed downtown and ate at Chipotle. Took the BART to Berkeley where we met Melvin. Wandered around the beautiful campus. Then we met Katelyn and David. We all went for Indian where we had a lovely lamb korma. Walked to Jupiter.

In the morning Phil blasted music and drove very fast and got us to the airport on time.

Rented a car in Santa Barbara. Drove up to Solvang and coincidentally caught the Danish Days festival. We took in sword demonstrations, folk dancing, Cuckoo clocks, and ebelskiver. Next to Pismo Beach for clam chowder (the white). Then to San Luis Obispo where we ate sushi at Goshi. We sat at the bar. The chef watched us eat and noticed us closing our eyes. He told us it was great that we were really appreciating the food and gave us a free tuna tataki.

To Kreuzberg for coffee and croissant donut. Passed zebras and listened to Alex Trebek on the bus to Hearst Castle. We only saw a few rooms, but thoroughly enjoyed it. Drove back down the coast and ate more chowder. I bought bongas from an antique store in Santa Barbara. Quick stop by the beach and then to the airport.
Locations: Santa Barbara, Solvang, San Luis Obispo

Description:
Slept on a bench for a few hours. To Temple Bar (not a bar). Bought a copy of A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man. Meal: carrot tarragon soup; sweet potato curry; salads and elderflower squash. Had some beer in the hostile hostel bar.

Bus tour south to Glendalough; a post-glacial valley with a lake, a cemetery, and a round house. Old tomb with massive cap stone. To Kilkenny. Had a great burger, bought a tin-whistle, and lay on the green. We met Alyse by the spire (a.k.a. the 'erection in the intersection', the 'spike on the dike', the 'stiletto in the ghetto', and the 'stiffy by the Liffey'). Wandered around. Found a nice pub with an American Bluegrass band and hung there a bit.

Had rashers & eggs for breakfast. Later we wanted a scone. I settle for a not very good one and I learned that while I get angry when I don't eat food, Liz gets angry when she eats bad food. Toured the Guinness Storehouse, which was interesting if rather self-indulgent. Hung in the Palace Bar and met Peter Freundlich. To The Boxty, which only had two boxtys on the menu. To another bar for some Tullamore Dew and a nice chat.

Didn't get on the flight so we flew to Barcelona instead. Stayed in that airport for a while and slept on the floor.

Got first class to Philadelphia. Had a great steak and watched The Sound of Music.

Dinner and drinks in Dallas at Victor Tangos.
Locations: Philadelphia, Brussels, Gent, South Downs, Brighton, Dublin

Description:
Walked through Hyde park. To the V&A Museum to attend the Bowie exhibition. Next to Soho where I bought a messenger bag from Ben Sherman that is still going strong five years later. To Golden Union for fish & chips and a honeycomb milkshake. We will return many times for this same exact meal. To 221b Baker Street to the the famous faux-home of Sherlock Holmes. Took a bus to Stansted to get a rental car. Practiced driving for a few and were off to Granny’s. Had cake and tea in the living room. We walked to Jade Fountain for good westernized Chinese food. Then we drove to the villa Anne and Richard had rentend for wedding party in the South Downs. Hung out with them and had a nice dinner at the house.

We all took a day trip to Brighton and came back to The Castle that evening for curry dinner.

The Lemaire's arrived the next morning. We took a tour of a local winery then headed into a small town for a French dinner, which the Niven’s joined in for. Liz & I headed into London for a 1930’s themed boat ride along the Thames. We missed the first half of the event and the live band, but still had a great time and everyone was looking quite sharp. Back to the house.

We wrote new vows and people started arriving for the reception. Ruth & fam, Rachel & kids, Fran & fam, plus many others came out. Jake and Jamie played soccer. Justin lay on the grass. Richard said a few kind words, Liz & I read paraphrased vows, and then we proceeded to take photos, eat, drink, and be married. Drove back to Stansted and had our first (and probably worst) Ryanair flight to Dublin.
Locations: Philadelphia, Brussels, Gent, South Downs, Brighton, Dublin

Description:
Met Didier and his other surfer, got beers, and went to the water to watch the fireworks. It was a great show with synced music. We drank more beers. Met Didier’s brother. We ate more fries.

Woke up at 2pm. Waffles with whipped cream & strawberries and a cappuccino at Mokabon. We canoed up the river and saw the castle and baby ducks. We listened to a concert from the water. The to an Irish pub for cider, cheesy bacon fries, and pork cheek in stout sauce. We happened to be there during a festival which I'm not sure how to describe. It was like theatre, art, music, and performance art happening all around the city. To a place called Bata Bata. Men in safari outfits immediately sat Didier in the king’s chair, and then carried him above their heads all around the place. There was an massive animatronic 'Farting Aunt'. They did something called 'ten-second techno'. There was a marriage proposal. Then there was a foam party. Went back to Didier's and watched many YouTube videos.

Took our time getting up and then on a bus for London.
Locations: Philadelphia, Brussels, Gent, South Downs, Brighton, Dublin

Description: Had a chicken curry sandwich for lunch. There were many tanks parked on the street. We learned a new king was to be anointed that day. Explored the Musical Instrument Museum - which doesn't hold a candle to the one in AZ. Ate curry ketchup fries and watched more military demonstrations. Drank a nice latte from a 3rd wave type shop. The Peeing boy was dressed up like a soldier, still with his penis out though.
Locations: Philadelphia, Brussels, Gent, South Downs, Brighton, Dublin

Description: We came upon two men who were arguing on the sidewalk. One began to walk away and the other ran up behind him and booted him in the butt. A woman walking towards us had lipstick all around her mouth and on her teeth. Into the massive indoor market. To an Amish diner for french toast with apple & cinnamon and eggs with scrapple – which is like sausage, spam, hash browns, and an omelet all at once. One serving was enough – ever. Found a chocolate shop that sold human body parts. Camped out at a coffee shop.
Locations: Philadelphia, Brussels, Gent, South Downs, Brighton, Dublin

Description: Ran into Bret at the departing gate. He was also doing a day trip to SF. He rented a car and took us to the Mission where we ate blue corn waffles and had a coffee. To Paxton Gate to look at dead animals and corpse plants. Found out Mom and Fred separated because a realtor called me asking about selling the house. Found out a plane had crashed at SFO shortly after we landed and that the runway was closed. This threw a wrench into our plans of flying standby back to Phoenix that night. To Fisherman's Wharf where we met up with Krystle and Devyn. We had some mediocre food plus beer. We then played games in a vintage arcade and took a photo booth strip together. We were picked up by Bret and went to SFO, which had reopened, but was a mess for anyone flying standby due to all the canceled flights. Every airport within a 200 mile radius was full for all travel. We almost made it on a United flight with Bret, but there was a system glitch and they didn't let us on even though there were open seats. Liz had a meeting scheduled the next afternoon in Phoenix so we rented a car and drove all night to get back by the next morning.

Went to Pepe'ete, but the town was pretty shut down as it was a Sunday morning. Back to the airport to rent a car. The automatics were about 3x more than the manuals, so we got a manual. Up until this point, I had basically never driven one though. Practiced trying not to stall in the parking lot for quite a while and then started driving around the island. With the exception of a rough start at the airport, a few stalls, not figuring out how to put it in reverse, and probably burning out the clutch, I think it went okay. To gloss over the gritty details I'll say that we were both fine, we didn't have to pay the $1,000 deposit, and I hope whoever got it next didn't have any trouble with third gear. We enjoyed driving up and down the cost and touring the island. We had a private room in the hostel. The other residents were mostly professional-aspiring surfers. We met a lovely SA man named Reese, who had been living there for three months in preparation to surf what he called his Mecca. Had a burger in a Las Vegas themed restaurant. Drove to the end of Tahiti Iti. Came back and made coconut tuna with carrots and shared with the other guests. On our way back up we stopped by a water logged cave and a very old temple complex, which felt rather Mayan. Here, Liz and I lay on the grass and watch the birds flying overhead. They had long tails which gave them a beautiful silhouette from below. Dropped the car off and took the bus into town. Found a cheap hostle. Wandered downtown. Visited a market, a church, some pearl shops, and a cafe where we ate more raw tuna. Wandered more. Had a beer and coffee at a cafe. Found a food truck lot and ate tuna fondue. Got a chow mein for breakfast. Went to bed.

Ate the chow mein, got on a plane, and watched Wreck it Ralph.

Flew standby to Tahiti then a prop plane to Bora Bora. A boat took us to the resort where we stayed in an overwater bungalow for two nights. Swam a bit and relaxed in the bay. Lots of sexy times. Played mini golf and went snorkeling. Dinner at Maikai Marina: ribeye w/blue cheese sauce and tuna carpaccio.

Incredible buffet where we had many things including a great eggs benedict, banana juice, guava jelly, and french toast. Spent the 2nd day playing pool and tennis, snorkeling, eating ice cream, and having cocktails. Dinner at St. James: raw tuna platter, steak with black truffle mash.

Great buffet again and more snorkeling. Moved to the main island and into a B&B on the side of the mountain. Went into Vaitape and watched some of the Heiva celebrations. The dancing and music were incredible and unlike anything I had ever heard. Ordered a massive raw tuna plate and a shrimp curry. Cut my jeans into shorts in the toilet with a steak knife. Walked through a casino in a tent where some kids were playing roulette. The majority of the patrons appeared to be children. Liz gambled with a few chips that a nice man gave her.

Did a day out boat excursion. The first spot was a reef with many colorful fish. Next was the black fin shark feeding area where we were surrounded by about 20 sharks. Island stop for lunch: BBQ fish, coconut ceviche, taro, tapioca, coconut bread, banana bread pudding, watermelon and grapefruit. We filled up. Long boat ride to a sandbar with stingray. The guides would grab the rays' 'nose' and ride them. I tried and one rammed my head into the side of the boat. Made a pizza and escargot in the hut.

Got a bit lost looking for our hotel. Heard a chorus of frogs. Found our hotel and had nice BBQ next door. They had a live magic show going on. I was surprised I was able to follow what was happening, but I guess magic is pretty universally understood.

One more empanada and a bus to the airport. Missed our stop (we didn't tell the driver to stop) and had to catch a cab the rest of the way.
Locations: San Jose, Monteverde, La Fortuna, San Ramon, Puntarenas, Montezuma, Isla Tortuga, Liberia

Description:
Took a ferry and a bus to Montezuma. Found a cute beachfront hostel for $10/night. Played with the hostel cat & dog and tried some seafood chowder the owner was making. Had some pizza. In the restaurant, Liz though she saw a cockroach scuttling across the floor. It was, in fact, a baby crab.

Woke up and planned a day out boat excursion. Waited for a boat on some steps. A local drunk man was walking seemingly aimlessly with four cute dogs happily following his every step. First to Isla Tortuga where we snorkeled around a big rock. The water wasn't clear, but we saw some interesting fish. Went to a second spot nearby and next to a small island. I found an octopus, though I frightened it and it squirted ink at me. I decided to swim around the island, which was a stupid idea. It was wavy and rocky and took about 20 minutes. When I came back around everyone was already back in the boat and waiting for me. Back to Isla Tortuga where we had pineapple, watermelon, beer, fish stew, and potatoes. Met some local wildlife including a large iguana, two vultures, two little pigs, a few parrots, many crabs, and a sweet cuddly boar named Jo. A marimba band was playing Beer Barrel Polka for some resort folks nearby. I played some volleyball with a Quebecois couple and then we all swam in the warm water. On the ride back it rained heavily and painfully right on us. To a nice restaurant in town for creamy avocado pasta, nachos, and a coconut milkshake.

Woke up and hiked to see a waterfall, but the river was too high so we couldn't get to it. We caught a bus to take us to Liberia. Our driver was going down the mountain (in a rickety bus with the door open) at a breakneck speed to apparently make sure we caught the ferry on time. We did.
Locations: San Jose, Monteverde, La Fortuna, San Ramon, Puntarenas, Montezuma, Isla Tortuga, Liberia

Description: Took a bus to San Ramon and ate breakfast. It was a nice town with worn down Mediterranean quality to it. Next to Puntarenas for cold beers and street meat sticks
Locations: San Jose, Monteverde, La Fortuna, San Ramon, Puntarenas, Montezuma, Isla Tortuga, Liberia

Description: Ate pancakes. Took a jeep-boat-jeep with stunning green mountains and majestic farming towns. Arrived in La Fortuna (rather appropriately named) without a plan. Thomas and his lady friend, however, did seem to have plans for us. What began with a seemingly friendly and only mildly suspicious encounter with an older expat American couple devolved into a shady situation where they were pressuring us to do very specific things (surely getting kickbacks from those companies). By the time we realized what they were doing we had already sat down for lunch with them and booked a room at a hostel they recommended (which we learned after booking had no A/C or lockers. While we weren't foolish enough to fall for the Chinese tea trick (we made sure the menu had prices listed), we did realize that this couple now knew exactly where we were staying and also felt they had the liberty to sit down with us for lunch. It got weird and he seemed to get annoyed that we didn't know what type of adventure we wanted to do. He informed us he would check in on us after lunch. He did manage to find us on the street shortly after lunch, but after giving him the cold shoulder we were able to shake him off. In the end, lunch was nice and we were able to get a refund from the hostel. We found another hostel with a pool (and two drink tickets). The tours in town seemed pricey and a bit contrived so we opted for a pool hangout day and more Arrested Development.
Locations: San Jose, Monteverde, La Fortuna, San Ramon, Puntarenas, Montezuma, Isla Tortuga, Liberia

Description: Had empanada at the bus station. Took a bus to Monteverde. The mountains were large, lush, misty, and dream like. We wound our way through them, passing many quaint farming towns along the way. We stayed at Cabinas el Pueblo, a cute B&B run by a local family. Went to Taco Taco for lunch. Did a Zipline canopy tour. It was incredible and we did probably fifteen lines with the last being a tandem (Liz and I) 1km line. Upon our return we had a malty, crunchy Nutella shake. Bought some toys for the kids. Touched real good. Ate dinner in a treehouse.
Locations: San Jose, Monteverde, La Fortuna, San Ramon, Puntarenas, Montezuma, Isla Tortuga, Liberia

Description:
Arrived in San Jose to a mostly barren downtown. Ate grilled chicken in a restaurant with very large puppets. To the hostel.

We watched Arrested Development. Had a vegetarian lunch at Vishnu. We explored the city which smelled of roughly 10% delicious food, 45% urine, and 45% exhaust. Found a John Lennon statue sitting on a park bench. Liz felt an earthquake in the middle of the night.
Locations: San Jose, Monteverde, La Fortuna, San Ramon, Puntarenas, Montezuma, Isla Tortuga, Liberia

Description: Ate some mediocre food at the Palazzo. Had incredible pastries from Bouchon Bakery. Quickly blew $40 on roulette. To the Bellagio Buffet for nigiri, maki, oysters rockefeller, lobster mac, prime rib, quail, lamb rack, boar leg, shrimp cocktail, smoked salmon, mussels, king crab, bananas foster, and a very full belly. Saw the Rolling Stones at MGM. They looked like skeletons, but they sounded great and Mick could really dance. Liz thought he was quite sexy. I ran 1.5 miles (with Street Fighting Man in my head) to get the car for Liz.

Met a few humans at the Grand Hilton. Then went to the Garden Bar at the Flamingo to meet the rest and have some drinks.

Woke up and had some drinks in the jacuzzi with Justin, Danielle, Nikki, Krys, and Devyn. Had too many people for one cab so we opted for a limo. The ceremony was quaint and lovely. Liz and I stopped at Gordon Ramsay's pub for a snack & drink before dinner. Then to Batista's for dinner. The food was crap, but we drank loads of wine and Devyn got drunk for maybe the first time. Liz, Justin, Danielle, Krys, Devyn, Gian and I wandered the casino for a bit. Justin saw a motorcycle as a prize above a slot machine and loudly proclaimed 'Hey, look at that motorcycle, fuck you!'. Liz and I saw Cirque du Soleil's Love at Mandalay Bay. The music and performance were both incredible. Then we literally ran over to Planet Hollywood to see a Cee-lo Green concert (to which Gian had just put our names on a list for). It was wild and pretty hokey, but incredible. At one point Boy George came out and did a lip-sync to a medley of his hits. A woman made a balloon penis and put it all the way down her throat.

To the Park restaurant on Fremont and checked out the Hoover Dam.

Arrived mid-day. Took the train downtown. Had a snack at Current for three-cheese rosemary popcorn and a few cocktails. Bought my wedding band from a pawn shop. Bought a pork pie hat from Goorin Bros. To the theatre for the concert. The opening act was a nice (not ska) two piece. Then The Specials performed. It was my first time seeing Terry Hall and I was perplexed by his stage presence. He didn't smile once and only from time to time would give any indication (such as a curtsy) that he was enjoying himself whatsoever. It was a blast. We met Andy after the show. He offered us a ride to the airport and we accepted. We slept, rather unsuccessfully, under a bench for a while until our morning flight.

Rented a car. Ate saimin and a passion fruit chiffon pie in Lihue. Drove south and west. Picked up some wine and snacks and headed to the beach. It was quite dark. The waves were loud and ominous. We had nap on the beach then slept in the car. In the middle of the night I tried to open the door and set of the alarm. It took us a few minutes to find the keys and turn it off.

To Waimea Canyon. Checked out an old Russian fort and had an orange. Walked around a coffee plantation and took pictures of lizards. Ate BBQ ribs in Lihue and drove north. Stopped at a few waterfalls. Picked up a hitchhiker. Stopped at a lighthouse and watched birds surfing the cliff winds. To the beach and played frisbee
WindowPlacement: a dog joined in for a bit. Continuing to a cave and went inside. To the end of the road. Sat on a beach and watched the sunset. Picked up a German hitchhiker and headed back to Lihue to fly home.

Description: The flight was weird. A mother with a baby was angry about changing seats even after the crew explained that in an emergency there wouldn't have been an oxygen mask for the baby. To NY. I bought a beanie and gloves. Train to downtown. There was a long line for the bathroom in Starbucks and some folks were pretty angry. Got put in a large pen full of people near 57th street. We could barely see The Ball as it was about ten blocks away. We stood around for 3.5 hours. It was crowded, but quite dark. We used the opportunity to take turns making each other feel nice. Later we met a lovely Colombian family. The had brought dried lentils, which are a good luck charm for the new year, and shared them with us. We put some in our pockets and threw some up in the air when the clock struck 12. The crowd had been extremely mellow for the entire wait (it's not very much fun waiting in a pen), then there was a period of maybe two minutes of excited celebration. Then the crowd nearly completely dispersed. A few minutes after midnight we were able to walk around a deserted Times Square. A horn band was playing Auld Lang Syne on the street (probably on loop the whole night). To a pub for a drink. Then headed back to the airport. On the train a girl threw up into her hands while wearing white plush gloves. Liz wasn't allowed in 1st class because she was wearing converse. I was though.

Anthony picked us up. To his lab where he played with mice and we saw some chimps in cages. Down to congress where we had pizza and checked out some shops. Went to La Barbeque and got meat heavy. The beef rib was the best piece of barbeque I've ever eaten. Over to Ryan, Amy, and Jolene's. Buffalo Trace at a whisky bar.

Up with Anthony and out to wine country. Walked around someone's vineyard until they came out and asked us to leave.

I knew I would propose on this day. I brought the necklace and the photostrip featuring me holding cards asking 'Will-you-marry-me?'. I made sure to have sock problems throughout the day to desensitize Liz to my getting down on one knee. I hadn't, however, decided where or when I would propose. We arrived and went to the Bellagio Buffet to eat, though we then decided against it and had crepes instead. We walked around the Bellagio and I visualized every spot as a potential location. I wanted to wait until it felt right...It didn't take long. When we were leaving the building the sun had just set, the fountains were on, and Elton John was playing through the speakers. We were walking down along the fountain. I stopped and asked Liz to hold my coat while I 'adjusted my socks'. I then asked her to get my phone out of my jacket pocket, where I had placed the photostrip. She patted the pocket and said it wasn't in there. I said it definitely was and asked her to check again. Then she pulled out the strip, read it, and looked at me. I was on one knee holding the necklace open and asked her if she would marry me. She jumped down to my level, wrapped her arms around me, and started kissing me. After a minute she stopped kissing me, looked me in the eyes, and said 'YES!'.

We kissed some more and then continued walking as we had reservations for the Penn & Teller show. On the way she called her parents — who already knew of course — and informed a few of her friends. The show was fantastic. Liz even participated in the show by reading a joke from a joke book to the audience, which was tied to one of their magic tricks. Liz found Puppy's mouse, which he snuck in her bag. Then we caught a plane home.

Arrived and went to Boulder City for the helicopter ride. We saw the cliff Thelma and Louise drove off of. The canyon was massive and majestic. We landed at the bottom and had some snacks and champagne. To the Riviera, which was old, but not in the charming way Imperial Palace was. We saw a mediocre comedy show. Liz says that we slept a lot...I think she means together.

Took a bus into Seattle. To Pike's Place for a grilled cheese, jackhammers, and a terrible cup of coffee. Bought wine for our Couchsurfing host. To the flying fish spot. To slow bar for better coffee. To the house where the key was hidden in a potted plant. Met our wonderful host, Larry, drank the wine, made white russians to go, and went downtown in his convertible mini cooper. To gum wall and a bar for snacks and chats. To another local CS host's house where we listened to late Smashing Pumpkins,  ate fish & chips, and played a little music. To Montana Bar for a coffee cocktail. Met a dog and also met Liz's friends. Whirlwind back to the airport and home.

Our first mission was to eat some poutine. We did. Then we crossed the bridge to Granville Market where we looked through kaleidoscopes and ate olives and purple peppers. Took the bus to our hotel. It dropped us off near the hotel in Vancouver's equivalent of Skid Row. We were surrounded by homeless people. It was a very strange sensation. Though no one interacted with us, being dropped off in the middle of a derelict street put us in a bit of a state of shock. While nothing was said between us, we had each silently decided we would cancel the hotel. However, when we crossed the last block to the hotel we found that mood suddenly changed. It was as though the large homeless community consciously decided that their area ended there. In the end we kept our booking, thoroughly enjoyed the hotel, and didn't have any issues with the next door community. Walked downtown where we watched a very talented roller skater/dancer.

We got up and headed to Stanley Park where we rented a tandem bike. It was a bit tricky to ride at first, but we got the hang of it after a while. Finished that and then found some cheap sushi. To the gay district for more poutine. It was cold out so we went to the movie theatre and watched Looper. The tickets were expensive so after Looper we snuck in to see The Master. Headed to Greyhound terminal early (though late at night), but it was closed. We tried to sleep on the street, but it was too cold so we went into a McDonalds. They let us hang out there, but they wouldn't let us sleep so we forced ourselves to stay awake. It was still better than trying to sleep outside.

Megan picked us up. Ollie was building a photobooth. Met Nacho (their cat) and looked at portraits of gorillas. Megan showed my lyrics to a song I wrote her years ago. I was disgusted by the amature quality of the writing.

To Voodoo Donuts then Powell's for some books, which included Point Omega and a 12-volume set of Lewis and Clark's journals for Richard. A quick hello to Alex Novie. To Stumptown Coffee then Burnside Skatepark to watch some good skating. Hawthorne for poutine and then we met Paige. Had Negroni's and lasagna and talked into the night.

Left and found a shop with a delicious smoky orange latte. To Pine State Biscuits for sausage & biscuits and fried green tomatoes. Next to Paxton Gate, a humoristic macabre taxidermy shop. A highlight was a mouse dressed as Hamlet holding a mouse skull.
People: Megan Irwin, Alix Novie, Paige & roommates

Description: Mom invited us to stay with her during her postal convention. At a Disney World seafood restaurant I tried Scotch for the first time (Johnny Walker Black)
WindowPlacement:
it was difficult to swallow.

Spent most of the day doing Magic Kingdom and Hollywood Studios. Met Helen that night and walked along the beach.

Hitchhiked to the airport.

Description:
Fran's house. Tate museum. Curry family dinner.

Took a train to Swanley Village and met Elaine. To Ightham Mote and saw the crypt. Saw some Welsh signs. David came home. He drove us very quickly to an incredible Indian restaurant. Then they gave us their vinyl record collection!

To Grannie's for tea, biscuits, and a drizzly afternoon. We ate Crispy duck and strawberries and cream.

Breakfast was rashers and instant coffee. Took the train to Soho. Liz found a lovely dress. I shopped at Ben Sherman. Went back in time to a 1940's ball. There was a live swing band and there were loads of people in amazing panoply. We nearly weren't let on our bus due to tardiness, but Liz argued our way on board. To the Manchester airport for bad coffee and 2 kilos of CDM.
People: Fran & fam, David & Elaine, Helen, Barbara, Peter,

Description:
After a Croque Madame near the station we spent a good chunk of the day looking for a hotel. Apparently everything in Paris (under $400) was booked that night. We asked Richard if he could put us in touch with his friend Philippe, and he did. We went to their place that night and had a lovely chat with the Lemaire family.

The next morning we went to the market with Claire and had a nice lunch at the house consisting of saucisson, tomates et fromage. To Montmartre and Sacre Coeur. Went to a Lapin Agile, a cabaret, which we learned is not the same as a burlesque. This was a room of locals sitting around a piano singing essentially French drinking songs. It was a blast.

The Rodin garden, Cotume, and Pere laChaise...were all closed. Instead we picnicked under the Eiffel Tower. I attended a Brian Eno & Mond Kopf concert with Philippe and had a lovely conversation on the train home.

To the Rodin statue garden for some excellent statues. To Cotume for delicious coffee. Tp Pont Neuf and Musee D'Orsay. We sat on steps outside the museum and ate ice cream. There was a wild, hairy, potentially-homeless looking man doing some of the best street comedy I have ever seen. The funniest parts were when he would walk behind a very posh woman an mimic her gate or run right up to someone and scream as though he was very startled. Walked Champs Elysée, Arc de Triomphe and then took a night bus to London.

Had a long layover in Philly. Went to the 'Original Cheesesteak' from Geno's. It was greasy and not very good. Had a nice root beer somewhere else and found a bar that Mac opened, which is nothing like Paddy's Pub.

Had a Thai tea sweet potato popsicle in a vintage 2nd hand store's garden. Walked around the city hall for a bit and then Barb picked me up. Went to their place and went to a Turkish restaurant where I had a lovely grilled fish. I borrowed Dad's truck while he was ato work and took a solo trip to Lake Tahoe. I rented a kayak and paddled around Emerald Bay. I went to Fannette Island where I climbed to the top and read a bit of Fear and Loathing. I drove around the lake. At one point I stopped and thought I would get in the water. I jumped in the lake, which was so cold I was paralyzed for a few seconds. I quickly got back out. I saw a brown bear and her two cubs upon a hill and watched them for a while. Liz arrived that night and I had a nice guitar jam with Dad.

Up to Napa where we visited the Chandon winery and snacked on some lovely charcuterie. To a casino where Barb and Dad treated us to a lovely steak meal. Afterward we walked around the casino, but I got kicked out for not having an ID. The flights looked bad so we drank a lot of wine and took a bus to San Francisco, where we then caught a plane back to Phoenix.

Kelly picked us up from the airport and drove us to Worcester, where we met Chris and Scout (her rabbit). I was quite sick. We explored an old church and a lovely outdoor area. They call her uncle Anne Frank because he's on the run from the authorities and lives in a basement. We then met Lucy. We listened to the soundtrack of Where the Buffalo Roam and a lot of Neutral Milk Hotel with the occasional Ice Cream Paint Job thrown in. I painted an ant's leg with nail polish to keep better track of it.

Met David and Elaine at the Hard Rock in Times Square. Had some dinner there and caught up a bit. Stayed with Todd & Sophie in Brooklyn and had some quesadillas together.

Explored the Lower East Side and had some great pizza. Watched Moonrise Kingdom with Todd and Sophie and brought wine into the theatre. Liz and I got locked out of their place and I considered climbing the fire escape, then I thought better of it.

Our first time on Fremont Street. I wish I would have gone as a kid so I could see how much it has changed since even the 90's. To Hash House A-Go-Go for griddled mozzarella fried chicken plate. We wanted to gamble, but we were too cheap for even the Imperial Palace (though we loved its charm). Then to House of Blues for Strip Strip Hooray: Murray Hill was the MC and he was perfect. His catchphrase was 'SHOWBIZ' and he made sure to beat it into us.

Came to town for a vintage expo. Found a 60's silk tie with Marilyn Monroe's Playboy centerfold printed on it. Stayed with Jesse. We went to Universal Studios together and had some nice potato dumplings in Burbank. We went to a gong karaoke. I stupidly tried to sing John Denver's Thank God I'm a Country Boy. I didn't hit a single word, but they let me stay on for a little while because I started unbuttoning my shirt.

Attended a music therapy conference in town. Went to a neat punk bar with Kim Headlee one night. Didn't make the stand-by flight going back Monday morning so I stayed for an extra day and went skiing with Tim, Emily, and Emily from the conference.
